title: [Large-Scale] Teaching Methodology Utilizing English Learning Motivation Strategies: Blended Learning-Based Language Acquisition and Expressive Skills Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English communication skills (conversational level) and understanding of fundamental grammar structures, experience with digital tools (tablets/laptops), and ability to perform simple text comprehension and writing tasks
context.additional_context: Blended classroom environment utilizing digital devices (tablets/laptops). Requires small-group collaborative spaces for project execution. Activity-centered design to enhance learners' reading comprehension, writing, and expressive skills. Feedback system incorporating peer assessment (grammar, vocabulary, structure feedback) and self-assessment (reflection on expressive abilities). Application of motivational strategies (reward systems, goal setting).

learning_goals: Enhance the will to sustain English learning by ≥80% using motivational strategies (e.g., goal setting and reward systems) and strengthen self-reflection abilities and writing expression diversity through weekly learning journals.

Use digital tools (Quizlet, Google Docs, etc.) to establish a weekly English vocabulary learning plan (≥3 times/week) over 2 weeks, achieve ≥80% execution rate via weekly checklists, and improve vocabulary application skills and reading accuracy incorporating peer feedback.

Achieve the following objectives during a 2–4 week mid-term course: 1) Complete 1 English role-play and 1 poster production for project-based assessment. 2) Write ≥3 weekly learning journals (including reflections on reading, writing, and expression skills) and submit ≥2 peer feedbacks. 3) Implement English learning motivation strategies (including goal setting and reward systems) with ≥80% adherence (checklist-based). 4) Demonstrate ≥20% improvement in fluency during oral presentations (≥3 minutes) and ≥20% improvement in grammatical accuracy and lexical diversity in writing (≥150-word essays).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
